item.title: Rhythm ToDo List and Development Notes
item.description: Rollbar In for Rhythm Foot Control Pad for Computer Rhythm TODO: System Playlists Search/Playlist = yet-driven Client Authentication AdSvc System Test Server Test Client Client: Finish Designs Client: Can Resume Spot on App boot Coming Soon: Can make playlists Client: iOS Bottom Nav Bar (spacing iOS) Ensure autoplay works (80%) Search playlist screen Queue → Page; Keep Playing Allow Ben to use Cmd block: get X(64 Diamonds -Igns Flick diamond Blue if you aren’t Ben; death!
item.content:
Rollbar In for Rhythm

Foot Control Pad for Computer

Rhythm TODO:

  • System Playlists
  • Search/Playlist = yet-driven
  • Client Authentication
  • AdSvc System
    • Test Server
    • Test Client
  • Client: Finish Designs
  • Client: Can Resume Spot on App boot
  • Coming Soon: Can make playlists
  • Client: iOS

  • Ensure autoplay works (80%)
  • Search playlist screen
  • Queue → Page; Keep Playing

Allow Ben to use Cmd block:

  • get X(64 Diamonds -Igns Flick diamond Blue
  • if you aren’t Ben; death!

item.title: Mobile App Development and Monetization Notes
item.description: Triple Dot - App Requirements App Login - Registration Cache video, queue, comfort-style Reload on app start Coming soon - Location Changes (No Playback) [Scribbled marking/emphasis] CPI Metrics $30K/month = $1175 $300K/day = Licensing SDK Integration Amplitude SDK Appsflyer Facebook Ads SDK Revenue Calculations $15,000/day x 30 = $500,000 √ 5,000 $245,000 Organic Growth Targets 1700 organic ↓ 2700 organic in our system Diagram Description: There are several blue pen markings throughout, including underlines, boxes around text, checkboxes (□), and a scribbled emphasis mark.
item.content:

  • Cache video, queue, comfort-style
  • Reload on app start

x 30
= $500,000
√ 5,000

↓
2700 organic in our system

The layout appears to be informal meeting notes or planning documentation with various calculations and crossed-out items indicating revisions or completed tasks.

item.title: Smart Home Server and Development Notes
item.description: Smart Home Server Architecture Embedded MQTT Broker Located in a MQTT program, w/ GTOAC pub/sub functionality System Components: Linux – systemd startup script Windows – startup PS1 script Both connect to: Docker Container w/ MQTT Broker Network Setup: Contains some of the Raspberry Pi devices connected in a grid pattern Development Updates - 2025-02-15 Upload 2.3.14 Android/iOS Include 2.0.2 FlutterEarn SDK update [unclear] Shuffle to each of the test tracks [unclear] outage Program YouTube Search
item.content:
Smart Home Server Architecture

Embedded MQTT Broker

  • Located in a MQTT program, w/ GTOAC
  • pub/sub functionality

System Components:

  • Linux – systemd startup script
  • Windows – startup PS1 script

Both connect to: Docker Container w/ MQTT Broker

Network Setup: Contains some of the Raspberry Pi devices connected in a grid pattern

Development Updates - 2025-02-15

Upload 2.3.14 Android/iOS

  • Include 2.0.2 FlutterEarn SDK update
  • [unclear] Shuffle to each of the test tracks
  • [unclear] outage

Program YouTube Search

  • Scratch CofE GO 2
    • Hiring Pioneers (Unity) - iOS Organic - Playful Left ~ 100k online
    • Table in January

Project Status Questions

Are these scraped?

  • Linkin Park
  • Lauren Daigle

Note: Meaning poor search results is due to it being not scraped yet

Date: 2025-02-15

Diagram Explanation

The notes contain a simple network architecture diagram showing:

  1. A Smart Home Server setup with Linux/Windows startup scripts connecting to a Docker container running an MQTT broker
  2. A grid pattern of connected devices (likely Raspberry Pi units) that form part of the home automation network
  3. The MQTT broker handles pub/sub messaging for the entire system

item.title: Product Development Meeting Notes - October 22, 2024
item.description: Subsequent By Default Playful Rewards: ☑️ Test Attribution ☐ Push Up Social Auth (Staging + Client Builds + Firebase) ☐ App Usage Tracking Sync w/ Adam: What are our goals exactly ← Z.3.4 Here is what we provide summary ☑️ Send Adam Credentials encrypt Changes for [Lead Account-auth] ☐ Onboarding Wizard v2 (Quick vs Big) UserWise ☐ Mongo 5 → 6 ☑️ Staging ☐ Production ☐ Frontend Changes >_< ☐ FlowRefs during?
item.content:
Subsequent By Default

Playful Rewards:

  • ☑️ Test Attribution
  • ☐ Push Up Social Auth (Staging + Client Builds + Firebase)
  • ☐ App Usage Tracking Sync w/ Adam:
    • What are our goals exactly ← Z.3.4
    • Here is what we provide summary
  • ☑️ Send Adam Credentials encrypt Changes for [Lead Account-auth]
  • ☐ Onboarding Wizard v2 (Quick vs Big)

UserWise

  • ☐ Mongo 5 → 6
    • ☑️ Staging ☐ Production
  • ☐ Frontend Changes >_<
  • ☐ FlowRefs during?
  • ☐ Global Revise config
  • ☐ Worker Job (time)
  • ☐ Push Notifications (scheduled send)

V2.3.4 Filter Out Recently Played (90-days) ⭐

Pepperfun Call Notes:

  • ☑️ Q1/Q2, for LiveOps: UW then?
  • ☑️ GCP??? Do we host for them?
  • ☑️ How do we integrate UW ↔ PT
    • UW would be a nice frontend
    • They would need custom features
  • ☑️ Start SaaS → Self-Hosted (pre-live)

PubSub Realtime Flow

  • ☐ They provide segments to us.

Diagram Description: At the top of the page, there’s a diamond-shaped diagram with “Push Out RTTR DEN to be Client” written inside it, with “Subsequent By Default” noted above.

There’s also a box labeled “OMG” in the middle section, and “GCP” appears in a box at the bottom right of the notes.

Date: 2024-10-22

item.title: Appuser Effect System Design Notes
item.description: Date: 2025-05-30 Appuser Effect Structure Appuser Effect / \ Appuser Effect Key Components: Appusers: Jobs/Archive - stores records (Appuser Effect) Appusers: AppuserSpecialOffers: {Claim, process} - both offer examples of AppuserEffect creation AppuserEffects: Jobs: Complex - more appuser effects = more complex Player: Appusers: Advice: CeaseReward - shows usage of Appuser Effect + Effect to cease bonus rewards Effect should be RewardableSub Earn Sources Fluent Presage offers Presage Magic Receipts Presage surveys Revli Moshbox/Besitos Kruiser System Flow Diagram POST Find or Create Find or Create (send code) → (Idle 24-hour → (appuser archive Effect) Effect) Event Processing Receive Earn Source → Appusers: AppuserEffects: Apply Earn Modifiers Event (Reward, appuser) BOOSTED - Add another use reward record
item.content:
Date: 2025-05-30

Appuser Effect Structure

Appuser Effect
/ \
Appuser Effect

Key Components:

  • Appusers: Jobs/Archive - stores records (Appuser Effect)
  • Appusers: AppuserSpecialOffers: {Claim, process} - both offer examples of AppuserEffect creation
  • AppuserEffects: Jobs: Complex - more appuser effects = more complex
  • Player: Appusers: Advice: CeaseReward - shows usage of Appuser Effect + Effect to cease bonus rewards
    • Effect should be RewardableSub

Earn Sources

  • Fluent
  • Presage offers
  • Presage Magic Receipts
  • Presage surveys
  • Revli
  • Moshbox/Besitos
  • Kruiser

System Flow Diagram

POST Find or Create Find or Create
(send code) → (Idle 24-hour → (appuser archive
Effect) Effect)

Event Processing

Receive Earn Source → Appusers: AppuserEffects: Apply Earn Modifiers
Event (Reward, appuser)

BOOSTED - Add another use reward record

Note: This appears to be technical documentation for a reward/effect system in a software application, detailing how user effects are structured, various earning sources, and the flow of processing rewards and bonuses.

item.title: LED Strip Simulator & App Playtime Tracking System Design
item.description: Architecture Overview [Diagram showing system flow]: Computer/Server → MQTT → Property PI → LED Strip (146 Strip) ↓ 5v External Power Hardware Specifications AllOZ: Speed Run components Dimensions: 10 x 12 grid configuration Power: External 5v power supply required Software Components EEPROM (LED Strip Simulator) Features: Zone Handwriting OIC → Upload Jobs Intervals: “daily” / “hourly” Package Name: [unclear] App Playtime Tracking System AppPlayTimeScheduleWorker AppPlayTimeTrackingWorker Scheduled Worker System [Diagram showing worker flow]:
item.content:
Architecture Overview

[Diagram showing system flow]:

Computer/Server → MQTT → Property PI → LED Strip (146 Strip)
↓
5v External Power

Hardware Specifications

  • AllOZ: Speed Run components
  • Dimensions: 10 x 12 grid configuration
  • Power: External 5v power supply required

Software Components

EEPROM (LED Strip Simulator)

  • Features:
    • Zone Handwriting
    • OIC → Upload Jobs
  • Intervals: “daily” / “hourly”
  • Package Name: [unclear]

App Playtime Tracking System

  • AppPlayTimeScheduleWorker
  • AppPlayTimeTrackingWorker

Scheduled Worker System

[Diagram showing worker flow]:

Scheduled Worker (runs every hour)
↓
Pull tracking worker scheduling/config
↓
(if config interval changed)
↓
Cancel/Unqueue Work ("PR AppPlaytime Tracker") + Enqueue/MagicWork

Shared Preferences & Interval Management

  • Interval: Set → Package → Interval
  • Config: If interval changed → get package name & interval
  • Tracking Worker: Manages scheduling updates

AppPlaytimeTrackingWorker Details

  • Frequency: Every X minutes (run @interval hourly)
  • Query: “Only query for this every 8.1 day”
  • Questions tracked:
    • Query → Has it been 1 hour?
    • If daily → Has it been 75 1 day?

Implementation Notes

  • Take CPF then spread it out
  • Feeling good about current progress
  • Corn Rate with Ham Interface integration planned

Diagram Explanations

  1. System Architecture: Shows the flow from computer/server through MQTT to the LED strip setup
  2. Worker Scheduling Flow: Illustrates how the background workers manage app playtime tracking and scheduling
  3. Hardware Layout: Shows the physical configuration of the LED strip array (10x12 grid)

item.title: Development Tasks and Roadmap - May 29, 2025

item.content:
IntelliJ: RocketBook → Tabled RocketBook → Markdown → Obsidian

General ToDo

  • Adobe/Playtime SDK upgrade to 3.1.0 : Playful Rewards

    • Cleave Section Horizontal
    • Hotlink Section

  • Update DoTs + Gender to match [unclear: Swah/Oth]

This appears to be a development roadmap with tasks divided into general, server-side, and client-side categories. The note includes integration plans for various tools and platforms, particularly focusing on a “Kiwi” project with SDK upgrades and new content sections.
